description: DC-OSPFV3 generates this trap when the state of a virtual
interface changes.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3VirtIfStateChange DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3PmEntRouterId a 192.0.2.1 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapVirtIfAreaId a 192.0.2.1 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapVirtIfNeighbor a 192.0.2.1 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3PmVirtIfState i 1 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapPmEntIndex u 9999

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the router in the
Autonomous System. The Router ID of 0.0.0.0 is reserved.
Note that the equivalent field in DC-OSPFv2 (ospfPmEntRouterId)
has a default value, whereas this field is mandatory and does
not.
This field cannot be changed if the row is admin status up and
row status active.

description: Version of ospfv3PmVirtIfAreaId used for traps.

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3IfConfigError DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3PmEntRouterId a 192.0.2.1 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapIfIndex i 9999 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapIfInstId u 0 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3PacketSrc s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEX DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3ConfigErrorType i 1 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3PacketType i 1 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapPmEntIndex u 9999 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapNmEntIndexValid i 1 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapNmEntIndex u 9999

description: Version of ospfv3PmIfInstId used for traps.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapIfInstId

description: The IP address of an inbound packet that cannot
be identified by a neighbor instance. When
the last value of a trap using this object is
needed, but no traps of that type have been sent
this value pertaining to this object should
be returned as 0.0.0.0.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3PacketSrc

description: Potential types of configuration conflicts.
Used by the ospfv3ConfigError and
ospfv3ConfigVirtError traps. When the last value
of a trap using this object is needed, but no
traps of that type have been sent, this value
pertaining to this object should be returned as
noError.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3ConfigErrorType

description: OSPF packet types. When the last value of a trap
using this object is needed, but no traps of
that type have been sent, this value pertaining
to this object should be returned as nullPacket.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3PacketType

description: Version of ospfv3PmEntIndex used for traps.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapPmEntIndex

description: Whether the trap was generated by OSPFV3-NM or not.

description: Version of ospfv3NmEntIndex used for traps.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapNmEntIndex

description: DC-OSPFV3 generates this trap when a packet is received

mismatching configuration.

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3NssaTranslatorStatusChange DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3PmEntRouterId a 192.0.2.1 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapAreaId a 192.0.2.1 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3PmAreaNssaTranslatorState i 1 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapPmEntIndex u 9999

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the router in the
Autonomous System. The Router ID of 0.0.0.0 is reserved.
Note that the equivalent field in DC-OSPFv2 (ospfPmEntRouterId)
has a default value, whereas this field is mandatory and does
not.
This field cannot be changed if the row is admin status up and
row status active.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3PmEntRouterId

description: Version of ospfv3PmAreaId used for traps.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapAreaId

description: Indicates if and how an NSSA Border router is
performing NSSA translation of type-7 LSAs into type-5
LSAs. When this object set to enabled, the NSSA Border
router's ospfv3PmAreaNssaTranslatorRole has been set to
always. When this object is set to elected, a candidate
NSSA Border router is Translating type-7 LSAs into type-5.
When this object is set to disabled, a candidate NSSA
Border router is NOT translating type-7 LSAs into type-5.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3PmAreaNssaTranslatorState

description: Version of ospfv3PmEntIndex used for traps.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapPmEntIndex

description: DC-OSPFV3 PM generates this trap when it enters or leaves
graceful restart helper state for a neighbor on a network
interface.

Summary.eval: ($v6==1) ? 'Device enters or leaves graceful restart hitless helper state' : 'Device enters or leaves graceful restart w/o hitless helper state of reason $v7'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3NbrRstrtHelperStatusChng DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3PmEntRouterId a 192.0.2.1 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapNbrIfIndex i 9999 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapNbrIfInstId u 0 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapNbrIpAddr a 192.0.2.1 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapNbrRtrId a 192.0.2.1 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3PmNbrRestartHelperStatus i 1 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3PmNbrRestartHelperAge i 0 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3PmNbrRestartHelperExitReas i 1 DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapPmEntIndex u 9999

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the router in the
Autonomous System. The Router ID of 0.0.0.0 is reserved.
Note that the equivalent field in DC-OSPFv2 (ospfPmEntRouterId)
has a default value, whereas this field is mandatory and does

This field cannot be changed if the row is admin status up and
row status active.

description: Version of ospfv3PmNbrIfIndex used for traps.

description: Indicates whether the router is acting as a hitless
restart helper for the neighbor.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3PmNbrRestartHelperStatus

description: Remaining time in current OSPF hitless restart interval
if the router is acting as a restart helper for the
neighbor. Set to zero if OSPF is not currently acting as
a restart helper for the neighbor.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3PmNbrRestartHelperAge

description: Describes the outcome of the last attempt at acting as a
hitless restart helper for the neighbor.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3PmNbrRestartHelperExitReas

description: Version of ospfv3PmEntIndex used for traps.
variables.name: DC-OSPF-V3-MIB::ospfv3TrapPmEntIndex

description: DC-OSPFV3 PM generates this trap when it enters or leaves
graceful restart helper state for a virtual neighbor.

Summary.eval: ($v6==1) ? 'Device enters or leaves graceful restart hitless helper state' : 'Device enters or leaves graceful restart w/o hitless helper state of reason $v7'
